Format downlink TTNv2
Check if radiosonde msg
Format downlink Helium
Helium MQTT Security warning
info:
As of December 1, 2021 Helium does not offer username/password security on their app page, leaving the MQTT connection to be unsecure.
  
My temporary security solution by simply adding the MQTT node ID provided by Helium to the topic.

Ideally, a bad actor will not have access the Helium console to get this ID number... otherwise we would probably have bigger troubles to begin with.

Format submitgps Action
Add battery
Add authorization and flags
Add rain,wind,solar
Set query
30-minute check
Parse response
func:
let new_payload = {};

let obs = msg.payload.observations[0]

devname = "blunderfrog1"

new_payload.devname = devname
new_payload.pressure_hpa = obs.metric.pressure
new_payload.humidity_percent = obs.humidity
new_payload.temperature_c = obs.metric.temp
new_payload.wind_dir_deg = obs.winddir
new_payload.wind_spd_ms = obs.metric.windSpeed
new_payload.rain_1hr_mm = obs.metric.precipRate
new_payload.light_intensity_lux = ''
new_payload.uv_index = ''

msg.authorization = { 'actor': devname, 'permission':'active'};


msg.payload = new_payload

return msg
